IN REPLY PLEASE USE THIS ADDRESS:
395 Peachstone Terrace
San Rafael, California
WELTON BECKET AND ASSOCIATES • ARCHITECTS
153 MAIDEN LANE • SAN FRANCISCO 8 • CALIFORNIA • EXBROOK 7-4 141 •
• ENGINEERS
CABLE VURDBECK
ROBERT L. DAYY
PUBLIC RELATION'S
January 3, 1961
Mr. William G. Harley
President, NAEB
1346 Connecticut Avenue NW
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Bill:
May the new year bring you the best of everything both
personally and professionally. I hope your holidays were
happy - spent in Madison, no doubt.
Bill, I wonder if you would do me a favor? As a result of
meeting Bob Schenkkan, Director of Radio and Television,
University of Texas, at the NAEB Convention here in San
Francisco, I am being seriously considered for a job as
Program Director for their new station which will go on
the air within a year (or possibly by February 1962). He
appears to be hiring staff now. If you could dredge up
some favorable comment (somehow) about me and my professional
capacities and pass these on to Bob it might put this over
the top - and at long last I would be actively and con¬
structively in the field I so much want to enter. It might
be well to indicate that you had heard that I had applied
for the job - rather than mentioning that I had written
to you. He has contacted my personal and professional
references already - but there have been budget delays,
evidently, and I feel this letter would be the right thing
at the right time.
I realize you don't know me very well - it was over 12 years
ago. But perhaps I have a nice smile? No? Well, perhaps
that it's MEANT to be nicel Anyway - you see what's needed
here. My professional accomplishments stand pretty well on
their own - I think he's interested in what I’m like as a
person.
LOS ANGELES • SAN FRANCISCO • NEW YORK • DALLAS • HOUSTON • HONOLULU
